He, David Mattern
May 7, 1956
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based
on rated transmitter power, as follows:
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - 4.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those
with 5 kw or more video power pay $100.00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members
receive our monthly Newsletter: the various reports and surveys we pub¬
lish periodically; services of our Placement Service, television engi¬
neer, legal counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal day-to-day
services, information, and advice that any national organization gives its
members. X am attaching some brochures which will gire you idea of the
functions and services of the Association.
In addition, Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The Net¬
work distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape record¬
ing, weekly, to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also based
on power (with the same power classifications as membership) and a new sta¬
tion does not have to pay the full fee until the third year it is in the
Network. The fees are:
Class A
Class B
Class C
500.00
300.00
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from
Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even a Class A sta¬
tion paying its full third-year rate is spying only a little over $2.00
an hour for better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in a
year. This is about the most inexpensive programming a station can do.
If you have any further questions about the Association, we would be most
happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
